_header: Jesu that hast me dear I-bought
Subjects: Passion, meditations on; Christ, Passion of
_description: A meditation on the Passion — 154 lines in couplets

Bod850.First Lines:
Ihesu þat hast me dere boȝtwrite nowe gosteli in my
                    thouȝt…
Bod850.Last Lines:
…As þou rose on estir dayIn ioy in blisse to haue
                    ay

BodeMus232.First Lines:
Ihesu þat hast me dere I boȝtWrite þou gostly in my
                    þoȝt…
BodeMus232.Last Lines:
…As þou rose vp on estre dayIn ioy & blisse to lyue
                    Ay

BodAddE4.First Lines:
Ihesu þat haste me der abouȝtewrite þou gostly in my
                    þouȝteþat y mow wiþ deuocioneþinke vpon
                    þi passione…
BodAddE4.Last Lines:
…As þou rose vpe on estyr dayeIn ioye and blisse to lyuen
                    aye
BodAddE4.Note:
At the start of the poem: ‘In seyinge of þis orisone
                    stinteþ & abideþ at euery crose and þinkeþ whate ȝe
                    haue seide ffor a more deuout prayer fonde y neuer of þe passione who so
                    abidingly sey it’.
BodAddE4.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte. 
             “Meditations on the Life and Passion of Christ, from British Museum MS.
                Additional 11307.” 
             EETS
         o.s. 158 (1921); repr. 1987: 60-4.

CamMagPep2125.First Lines:
Ihesu þat hast me dere ybouȝtWrit now gostly in my
                    þouȝt…
CamMagPep2125.Last Lines:
…Ihesu þat art so mychel of myȝtWrit in myn
                    herte…
CamMagPep2125.Note:
This MS lines 1-70 only; incomplete at end; written as
                    prose.
CamMagPep2125.Attributed Title:
Memoriale de ligno crucis cristi domini nostri (f.
                    76v)

BLAdd39574.First Lines:
Ihesu þat hast me dere boughtWrite now gostely in my
                    thought…
BLAdd39574.Last Lines:
…Os thow roos on estre dayIn Ioye and blys to lyue for ay.
                    Amen.
BLAdd39574.Editions:
Day,  Mabel,
                        ed.  
             The Wheatley Manuscript: Middle English Verse and Prose in British
                Museum MS. Additional 39574.
EETS
         o.s. 155 (1921; repr. 1971): 1-6.

Lam559.First Lines:
Ihesu that hast me dere boughtwrite nowh gostly in my
                    thought…
Lam559.Last Lines:
…write in myn harte thi speches swetewhen iudas the tratyour
                    gan the meteand ȝet thou callid hym thi frendgod send vs cherite
                    with outin ende. Amen

BLEge3245.First Lines: Ihesu þat hast me dere a bouhtWryt now gostly in my þouht…
BLEge3245.Last Lines: …As þow vp roos on esterne dayIn ioye and blisse to liuin ay
BLEge3245.Attributed Title: Here biginniþ an holy meditaciun behofliche to be þpoht or seyd with deuociun

Longleat29.First Lines:
Ihesu þat hast me dere I boghtWrite þou gostly in my
                    þoȝt…
Longleat29.Last Lines:
…As þou rose vp on estre dayIn ioy & blisse to lyue
                    ayeAmen
Longleat29.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,

Davies,  Reginald Thorne.

Longleat30.First Lines:
IHesu þat hast me dere boughtWryte now goostly in my
                    thought…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…In ioy & blis þar lasteth ayAmen amen for
                    chariteGod yeue vs grace so mot hit be

HunHM142.First Lines:
Ihesu þat hast me dere boughtWrite now goostly in my
                    þought…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…In ioy and blisse þat lesteth ayAmen amen for
                    chariteGod yeue us grace so mote hit be
HunHM142.Note: This MS with added verses, 177 lines in all.
